algorithm: {The novel local search strategy combines a probabilistic swap-based perturbation with a greedy selection of critical items, where items are prioritized based on their marginal contribution to both objectives, ensuring feasibility and high-quality neighbors are generated.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], weight_lst: np.ndarray, value1_lst: np.ndarray, value2_lst: np.ndarray, capacity: float) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_idx = random.randint(0, len(archive) - 1)
    base_solution, (current_value1, current_value2) = archive[selected_idx]
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    # Calculate current total weight
    current_weight = np.sum(weight_lst * base_solution)

    # Identify critical items (high value-to-weight ratio for both objectives)
    value1_ratio = value1_lst / (weight_lst + 1e-10)
    value2_ratio = value2_lst / (weight_lst + 1e-10)
    combined_ratio = value1_ratio + value2_ratio

    # Sort items by combined ratio (descending)
    sorted_items = np.argsort(-combined_ratio)

    # Perform a hybrid local search: probabilistic swap with greedy selection
    for item in sorted_items:
        if base_solution[item] == 1:
            # Probabilistically flip out an item
            if random.random() < 0.3:
                new_solution[item] = 0
                current_weight -= weight_lst[item]
        else:
            # Greedily add high-ratio items if feasible
            if current_weight + weight_lst[item] <= capacity and random.random() < 0.7:
                new_solution[item] = 1
                current_weight += weight_lst[item]

    # Ensure feasibility (minor adjustment if needed)
    if current_weight > capacity:
        # Remove items with lowest combined ratio until feasible
        excess_weight = current_weight - capacity
        for item in sorted_items:
            if new_solution[item] == 1 and excess_weight <= 0:
                break
            if new_solution[item] == 1:
                new_solution[item] = 0
                excess_weight -= weight_lst[item]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm combines a simulated annealing-inspired perturbation with a dominance-based selection strategy, where items are prioritized based on their Pareto-optimal contributions to both objectives, ensuring feasibility while exploring high-quality neighbors through adaptive temperature-based flips.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], weight_lst: np.ndarray, value1_lst: np.ndarray, value2_lst: np.ndarray, capacity: float) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_idx = random.randint(0, len(archive) - 1)
    base_solution, (current_value1, current_value2) = archive[selected_idx]
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    current_weight = np.sum(weight_lst * base_solution)

    # Calculate normalized marginal contributions
    marginal1 = value1_lst / (weight_lst + 1e-10)
    marginal2 = value2_lst / (weight_lst + 1e-10)
    combined_marginal = marginal1 + marginal2
    sorted_items = np.argsort(-combined_marginal)

    # Simulated annealing-inspired perturbation
    temperature = 0.5
    for item in sorted_items:
        if base_solution[item] == 1:
            # Flip out based on temperature and marginal contribution
            flip_prob = temperature * (1 - combined_marginal[item] / np.max(combined_marginal))
            if random.random() < flip_prob:
                new_solution[item] = 0
                current_weight -= weight_lst[item]
        else:
            # Add based on marginal contribution and feasibility
            if current_weight + weight_lst[item] <= capacity:
                add_prob = (1 - temperature) * (combined_marginal[item] / np.max(combined_marginal))
                if random.random() < add_prob:
                    new_solution[item] = 1
                    current_weight += weight_lst[item]

    # Dominance-based selection to ensure quality
    for item in sorted_items:
        if new_solution[item] == 1:
            # Check if removing this item improves both objectives
            temp_solution = new_solution.copy()
            temp_solution[item] = 0
            temp_weight = current_weight - weight_lst[item]
            temp_value1 = current_value1 - value1_lst[item]
            temp_value2 = current_value2 - value2_lst[item]

            # If removing improves at least one objective without hurting the other
            if (temp_value1 >= current_value1 and temp_value2 > current_value2) or \
               (temp_value1 > current_value1 and temp_value2 >= current_value2):
                new_solution = temp_solution
                current_weight = temp_weight
                current_value1 = temp_value1
                current_value2 = temp_value2

    # Ensure feasibility by removing lowest marginal items
    if current_weight > capacity:
        excess_weight = current_weight - capacity
        for item in sorted_items:
            if new_solution[item] == 1 and excess_weight <= 0:
                break
            if new_solution[item] == 1:
                new_solution[item] = 0
                excess_weight -= weight_lst[item]

    return new_solution
